data.title: A beautiful balance of history and elegance.
data.text: This is my second stay at the hotel. Both for business. The hotel is located downtown and is a short trolly ride from the waterfront. The rooms are beautifully done. I would recommend a higher floor and a King size bed. The restaurant is quite elegant and has a lot of history. Originally owned by President Grant, it is a bright spot in a downtown San Diego that is trying to reinvent itself with other destinations popular to both residents AND tourists like the Gas Lamp district.

data.title: Wonderful Location and Beautiful Room
data.text:
We checked in on a Monday afternoon and were delighted with our modern beautiful room.  It was quite a hike to the elevator but that was not an issue.  Unfortunately that evening after attending a concert across the plaza from the hotel our room key would not unlock the door.  We went downstairs and security came up with us.  Their key also didn't work.  Security called someone from maintenance who determined that we needed a new battery.  We stood around for about a half an hour before it was determined by the two men trying to fix the problem that it would take about an hour and the door couldn't be fixed that evening.  So we couldn't leave our room that night and would have to check out with all our belongings in the morning since the room couldn't be sused to come and go.  We asked for and got a complimentary breakfast in the restaurant downstairs.  We were a bit dismayed to find out that there was no notation on our account at check out that we'd had the trouble with the lock on our door and the inconvenience of having workmen there for approximately a half an hour of futile attempts to fix it.
In the end it did not ruin our stay but the communication between security and the front desk didn't seem to be 100%.  The breakfast we had (comped in the end) was delicious and the service couldn't have been better.  The atmosphere was very elegant, our waiter's and bus staff were attentive and friendly.  We ended our stay happy travelers.  Downtown parking is very expensive...the hotel fee is $48 overnight!

data.title: Beautiful Hotel!
data.text: A few years ago I had taken my Mom for dinner to the Grant Grill and enjoyed it very much. The hotel looked so  nice, I decided on my one day stop prior to our cruise out of San Diego, I would stay  here. It was close to the terminal, and it was just a great hotel with so much charm. It truly is. The staff are excellent and the rooms totally luxurious! Comfortable beds, great bathrooms/showers, linens everything. Its nice to stay in a building with some historical charm. There was only on hicup the night we were there. We went to the bar around 1230 to get a drink and they advised us it was closed!  The lady had to shout to the other staff member to confirm, yet there were people in there.  A true 5 star hotel would always serve their patrons especially when were within the legal limits of alcohol service.  We found this to be a bit rude and not in concert with such an establishment.  I enjoyed it otherwise and would come back. (wont go to the bar in the hotel however)

data.title: Excellent 4 Night stay in San Diego
data.text:
I spent 4 nights at the US Grant hotel in November during a trip to San Diego for a football game.  I stayed in a renovated Legacy Suite room and thoroughly enjoyed the accommodations and service.  The lobby and first floor the hotel is beautiful and very clean.  Front desk personnel were consistently friendly and helpful to requests.

Room 808 was recently renovated and actually still smelled like fresh paint.  The room is large and features a sitting area with an L-Shaped couch and coffee table.  There is also a work desk and another TV in the area where the bed is located.  The room also features a refrigerator (unstacked, which I prefer), coffee maker and safe.  The furnishings were new, and stylish(in my opinion).  Also, the bed was very comfortable.  The bathroom isn't very large and it is updated with a single vanity and shower only.  It easily got the job done for my solo stay but I could see it being a little tight if there was a couple staying in the room.  Overall, I would absolutely stay in this room again.  The entertaining area was perfect and utilized several times during my stay.

I dined at the Grant Grill on Thursday evening and received superior service while eating at the bar.  The food and drinks were both good and there was a live jazz trio adding to the atmosphere.  I also had breakfast once at the Grant Grill during my stay and it was excellent, as well.  The service was excellent for both meals.

The location is solid, easily within walking distance of retail, dining and the public transit system.  I would say it is in a fairly active part of town but not overly so that it was inconvenient as a guest.

I would definitely stay at the US Grant again and I would say that while the room was very good, the service was what stood out to me during the trip...which is what helps set a luxury brand apart for others.

data.title: My favorite hotel in San Diego
data.text: I stay at the US Grant every chance I get. It is not a modern hotel, so if that's what you care about, you won't like this place. It is old-school glamorous with fantastic furniture, chandeliers, damask wall paper, charming old elevators, and some people say it's haunted. Think Great Gatsby. It's classic, clean, and beautiful! I love almost everything about this hotel (only wish more rooms had bathtubs).

data.title: Timeless Elegance in the heart of Gaslamp Quarter
data.text: The US Grant is a respite of old-world sophistication in a great location. Since it is right across from a lively city park, you should expect a bit of street noise. But the rooms are well appointed, the beds are comfortable, the decor is elegant and the service is impeccable. There is a convenient shopping mall a block away and helpful valet staff to hail a cab or direct your Uber driver to the port cochere at the side entrance. The lobby is grand and beautifully refurbished. The on-site Grant Grill restaurant is fabulous for everything from drinks with entertainment to a leisurely breakfast or delicious dinner. I can't praise the staff enough - everyone is polished, professional and gracious, from housekeeping to front desk to concierge to porters to event planners. The in-room amenities are modern and the bath products are ample and luxurious. The building is historic, so along with the gorgeous fixtures you will experience some quirks like uneven water pressure at times, but nothing that spoils the enjoyment of the ambience here. The US Grant is an amazing place to host an elegant event and a perfect location for a romantic getaway.

data.title: Great Hotel Location and Okay Amenities.
data.text: This hotel is in the heart of downtown San Diego and its location is great. Service was superb and the building is beautiful. However, do expect a somewhat older type of hotel. The furniture and decoration are quite contemporary, but the amenities are small and a little clunky.

data.title: Beautiful hotel
data.text: This is a beautiful hotel. I felt like I was staying in a historic place, and I thought the bar area was breathtaking. Our room was comfortable. We were traveling with a baby and, while not especially family-oriented, we thought the hotel did everything you might expect to help us have a good stay.

data.title: Grand antiquity....
data.text: A grand, old dame that gives a polite separation from the hustle and bustle of the city.  Dining can be semi-formal (professional) but is worth it with the quality of food served by a professional staff.

data.title: Lovely, old school property in downtown SD
data.text:
Impressive hotel upon arrival. Lobby is old-school glamour- nicely renovated- elegant yet comfortable and approachable.
Front desk was helpful. Traveling w my daughter who likes to swim; unfortunately no pool in this hotel but they let us use the sister property at the Westin a few blocks away which was a nice touch.
Room was spacious. Bath had a large soaker tub but no free standing shower. I'm quite tall and had a little bit of trouble stepping in and out of the tub- for shorter folks I'd imagine this to be even more difficult. Water temperature was inconsistent as well- went from hot to hotter in seconds while showering. Not a huge deal but worth noting.
Valet were great. Super nice guys- great with directions, chilled water, opening doors etc. Price to park was excessive ($45+/ night) but these guys almost made it worth it.
Good neighborhood to be in- gaslamp district has lots of food options. Can be a bit sketchy w homeless people milling about but didn't cause any issues for us.
Overall a nice stay.

data.title: The Gand Hotel in Downtown doesn't dissapoint
data.text:
We were there for business and spent 3 nights in the hotel. Sometimes old hotels have barely renovated facilities and small rooms. Not here, it's been gutted and completely upgraded to luxury status. 
The bathroom is where you usually find grand dame hotels are lacking, even when renovated. Not here, the bathroom is very large, a huge walkin shower and top flight in every respect.
The room is huge, you have a lot of room and there is nothing small about it.
Food is very good if a bit pricey but this is not a budget hotel so the price is fair, even for San Diego. I found the bar carried the premium brand single malts I like and even had great TV's for the World Series.
Now, the staff. They are fantastic. The concierge was extremely personable and make me feel like a valued guest and not a street person who somehow made it inside like some of the high end places do. Gave me a history of the renovation and the challenges they had which added a lot of interest to being in the hotel. All the staff in the hotel greeted me like I lived there. Small touches that made being away from home feel more comfortable.
I recommend this hotel if you love the feel of the grand hotels of the past and enjoy that kind of ambiance.

data.title: 1 night stay
data.text: stayed here for one night after getting of cruise before flying home arrived at hotel about mid day room was not ready which was fine as its not usually available till 3 pm  they took my phone number told me my suite was empty so would get housekkeping on it and give me a ring went back 2 hours later  oh yes we were just about to call you .  was left standing at reception why receptionist went of to do other things whilst checking mme in  / this hotel is spose to be luxury  the reception staff are not very professional as im visually impaired and asked where the lifts were no one showed me just waved in the sir over there  and when i held my stick up and said i cant see they just done nothing . breakfast  the staff were nice and polite bt thats where it ends the food is less than luxury hotel standard ive stayed in  lucury hotels all around the world this one falls far short may look fancy but thats about it and the floor in the bar area and breakfast room was sticky as my shoes kept stickig to the floor

owner_response.author: Robert B, Hotelier at The US Grant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Oh My! We seemed to have missed that target, Sarah-Jane. We are very sorry for this unpleasant experience after your cruise. What should have been a rather flawless unwind phase from the adventures at sea, turned into raw disappointment. My team shared your valuable feedback with our dedicated hospitalians and we expect constructive discussions and remedies to result from it. Sad to have lost your trust so abruptly but we do hope that we can regain that on a future visit.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Business/Personal
data.text: Great stay! Started out as a business meeting but ended up as our anniversary celebration. While in meeting, the concierge made all of my arrangements for a surprise anniversary celebration. Even surprised us with chocolate covered strawberries in the room when we returned. Experienced nothing but top notch service.

data.title: Nice, but not luxurious
data.text:
I was excited to stay here on my recent visit to San Diego.  The photos looked amazing.  However I felt like this hotel was just OK.  Overall I feel like they did the bare minimum to have the look of luxury but I was left feeling cold and disappointed.   The staff were all really amazing and helpful - so I don't want to miss giving them praise.  We had a deluxe room that was large but had little furniture and what was there wasn't inviting.  The bathroom as very large but again - there was nothing in it but the vanity with the sink so it felt like it had been robbed of something - just lots of floor space.  The toilet paper holder was falling off the wall, the was not place to hang towels besides one hook that had the bathrobes on it. The bathroom fixtures were just average - not cool looking or special.  

The bed was very comfortable and the sheets/pillows were great.  The towels were thick and new.  The bath products were nice.

The main lobby feels the same - empty and cold and not inviting.  I feel like they a redo on the cheap and needed to take it to the next level to get that "luxury" feel.  I like it overall but probably wouldn't stay here again.

data.title: Work conference
data.text: The U.S. Grant offers excellent accommodations for a trip to the San Diego area.  This location is in the heart of the Gas Lamp District which is full of places to eat, nightlife, and within easy walking distance of the U.S. Midway museum.  The U.S. Grant provides complementary bottled water, robe, and slippers! The staff asked upon arrival my departure flight time and adjusted my checkout to match my pickup for the airport.  The property itself is beautiful and includes an impressive art gallery.

data.title: Beautiful historic hotel, excellent service, horrible view.
data.text: Attended a business function at this hotel.  As the title states, it was a beautiful, historic hotel, well maintained.  They managed to update it enough to provide what you'd expect in a newer bathroom.  The service was also excellent.  The rooms are a bit on the small side but adequate and very nice.  The only downside to the overall experience was the view from the room, or lack thereof.  A big deal for me, traveling in hotels most every week, is the view I'll find when I open the curtains.  This was one of the worst.  There was a roof outside, sloping upwards so to even call it a view would be a stretch.  Aside from providing sunlight, you couldn't see anything.  Bummer, my first trip to San Diego and staying downtown, only to see nothing from the windows...

data.title: So bad....
data.text:
My husband and I had booked the US Grant hotel for 4 nights (via Hotel.com/Expedia)

Immediately when you walk in you can tell that the hotel is just trying to keep up with a certain glorious past.

The check in was ok… but the hotel is under renovation so you don’t have water between 11am and 3pm on Tuesday and Thursday. Ok… we had arrived from a 6 hours flight and would have love to shower in our 300$ hotel room.

They gave us room 413. A dark room with no view, disgusting white fabrics for the bedhead, awful paint finishes, wall scratch… etc…just dirty

Yes its not neat, it s looking tired and it's not renovated.

Did I mention there s no mini bar in the room? I mean is this a 2 stars hotel not a 5 which it i meant to be?

There s no pool in the hotel

 The gym is under renovation, so don’t expect a good workout!

 We complained to the manager and even if Hotel.com/Expedia agreed to let us get a refund the US Grant didn’t want to let us check out and refund 3 or at least 2 nights…” Hotel policy” . Not to mention the tone they spoke to us in.

 We travel a lot and we have had this story before at the Venetian in Las Vegas. The hotel kindly agreed to let us check out and refund the prepaid rooms. I think its better to let an unsatisfied customer leave and refund 600$ than keep the upset client ‘s money and keep him “hostage” of a hotel policy… That is just not nice….

Well what to say.....We just moved to a hotel called “l Auberge del Mar”. Totally different area but guess what… It was just perfect.

owner_response.author: Robert B, Hotelier at The US Grant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are actually no longer under full renovation. Our ongoing guest room re-fresh phase is still under way but not affecting any other guest rooms or lobby spaces. Sporadic and limited water shut-offs can be part of routine maintenance work that we perform during this time of the year. Water is however flowing freely during the hours of 11AM and 3PM. Also the fitness center is now re-opened and truly state of the art, set in a beautifully designed space on our historic lower level.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Average luxury hotel
data.text:
Stayed here for business and found this so called luxury hotel to be average at best.  That said, it is in an old building that seems run down and the renovation seems to be due for a renovation again.  For example, the rooms have antique TVs.  That alone tells me this hotel is average. 

The customer service at our meeting room was very good.  The front desk at check out was much more concerned with their policy than with me as a customer so I rate that part of the experience as poor. 

I do not recommend this hotel.  Many much better options in the area.

owner_response.author: Robert B, Hotelier at The US Grant, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We wish you would have had a more stellar experience, David. Nevertheless we appreciate you giving us the insight on your stay. 
Actually, our 106 year young 'historic' hotel is currently under a full renovation and with the lobby and public spaces being nearly completed, we are working diligently on the guest rooms. The fact that you didn't take note of it shows us how of an in-disruptive process it is. We apologize however that you had to experience some in-deficiencies and wish that you would give us another chance when in town next. Since there are no longer many better options in the area after we are done with our re-fresh, you definitely want to try us out again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: BEST SHOWER EVER!
data.text:
Wonderful location, friendly staff, fantastic bathroom facilities, comfy beds, secure.

THE SHOWER ROOM IN OUR SUITE WAS EPIC! Massive, warm, perfect pressure control.

The carpets are looking a bit old and worn, but that is my only criticism.

owner_response.author: Robert B, Hotelier at The US Grant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: You must have stayed in one of our Signature Suites, Rach! They are superb indeed but for any explorers out there, looking for the most exceptional shower experiences, we change them slightly during our on-going re-fresh phase. We are also happy to announce that all the carpets are being changed as part of our renovation efforts. We are sorry for having caused some disappointment with that on your recent visit but know you will absolutely adore the new ones. When will you be back again to test our new showers??
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Concert going
data.text: My daughter and I drove up from LA to watch a concert and after sitting in the car for many hours, and several more at the concert, it was very nice and alluring to return to this amazingly posh hotel! The hallways were quite stylish and our room and bed were so comfortable, we didn't want to leave... I called down and they gave us a late checkout, and didn't charge us extra! I think it had to do with Amex, which also gave us a most delectable brunch when we finally awoke. Parking is pricey but there are not many options. Hotel is across from Horton Plaza, which is a MUST see! Also, I warn against walking alone at night.
